description: Unique identifier for the part inventory record.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this part’s inventory record.
Indicates whether this item’s quantity is tracked in inventory.
Flags that the item carries a refundable core deposit/return requirement.
Marks the part as inactive and unavailable for normal transactions.
Identifies the item as specialty equipment rather than standard stock; confirm with SME.
Indicates the item is purchased directly for jobs rather than stocked.
Flags this item as a substitute or allows substitution with alternatives; confirm with SME.
Scannable code associated with the item for identification at receipt/issue.
Short business description of the part.
Primary internal part number (inventory SKU) used to identify the item.
Free-text notes specific to warranty coverage or handling for this part.
General notes or remarks about the part.
Projected available quantity after considering pending receipts and allocations; confirm with SME.
Quantity currently on purchase order or recommended to order for replenishment.
Total inventory value or extended cost for this item; interpretation may depend on configuration. Confirm with SME.
Quantity available to issue (on-hand minus reserved/allocated amounts).
On-hand quantity currently in stock.
Quantity reserved for work orders or other commitments.
Unit cost used for valuation and purchasing (standard, average, or last cost per setup).
Monetary amount of the core deposit linked to this part.
Reference or attachment to documents related to the part (e.g., spec sheet, manual).
Stored schedule or configuration data related to this part (XML); likely reorder or maintenance settings. Confirm with SME.
Identifier of a related task or job this part is associated with; confirm with SME.
Readable description for the related task reference.
Default quantity increment/step used when issuing or receiving this part; confirm with SME.
Readable description for the quantity increment setting.
Indicates whether tiered inventory pricing/levels are enabled for this part; confirm with SME.
Readable description for the tiered inventory setting.
Indicates whether a safety data sheet is required/maintained for this item.
Readable description for the safety data sheet flag.
Original equipment manufacturer cross-reference number for this part.
Readable description or formatted display of the OEM reference.
Code for the base unit of measure used to stock this item.
Description of the unit of measure code.
Code identifying the manufacturer of the part.
Manufacturer name/description corresponding to the manufacturer code.
Inventory category code used to classify the part.
Category description corresponding to the category code.
Inventory type classification for this part.
Inventory management/costing method applied to this item.
Rule for printing barcode labels for this item.
Binary image/photo stored for the part.
Identifier for this record in the legacy/source system.
Name of the source table from which this record originated.
Number of months until the item expires once received/activated.
Manufacturer’s part number.
Indicates whether the item’s shelf life is tracked/enforced.
Requires entry of a unique serial number when issuing this item.
Indicates whether quantities or prices are rounded during transactions for this item.
Indicates that unit-of-measure conversions are applied for this item.
Code representing the item’s color attribute.
Color description corresponding to the color code.
Code representing the item’s size attribute.
Size description corresponding to the size code.
Default unit of measure used when issuing this part to work orders.
Description of the default work-order unit.
Default unit used when returning this part to stock.
Description of the default return unit.
Default unit used for fuel-related transactions involving this item.
Description of the default fuel unit.
Default unit used when receiving this part on purchase orders.
Description of the default purchase-receipt unit.
Default unit used when recording consumption of this part.
Description of the default consumed unit.
Default unit used for tire transactions involving this item.
Description of the default tire unit.
Default unit used for tool-related transactions involving this item.
Description of the default tool unit.
Default unit used for fluids or lubricants associated with this item.
Description of the default fluids unit.
Default unit used when posting inventory adjustments for this item.
Description of the default adjustment unit.
Default unit used when transferring this part between locations.
Description of the default transfer unit.
Sub-classification code within the item’s type hierarchy.
Description of the subtype code.
Top-level classification code for this item.
Description of the type code.
Integration field mapping this item to an external system’s fuel type; confirm with SME.
Rule defining when warranty begins for this part, such as purchase or installation date.
Identifier of the related core item linked to this part.
Name/description of the related core item.
